channel.title: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?
channel.description:
I've been trying to get on the IRC for a few days now but each attempt leads to it saying that it can't connect. Here's the error message I get:
[01:28] Connecting... [01:28] Unable to connect : java.net.SocketException : Permission denied: connect
I have the current version of JRE and JDK. So I don't know what the problem could be. What do you think? This also happens on every other Java applet I try to view. I keep getting errors. I miss my Java. :(

item.title: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

MITB, you’re a genius, but sadly it didn’t work. I think there’s a problem with my windows firewall. Also, I don’t have internet security. Microsoft ripped me off and gave me Norton Internet Security that expired the second I turned on my lap top. I know the problem lies within my firewall, but I don’t know what to do to fix the problem.

Read full topic
item.source: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?

item.title: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It is TCP port 6667. The problem isn’t with java at all, but something on your computer or network is blocking you from connecting to port 6667. Many anti-viruses and universities do this because some malware connects to IRC servers to get commands and such. What you should be able to do to get around it is connect to irc.moparisthebest.com port 6697 with SSL enabled. You can do this in xchat by typing this in the window, after you connect to any network. “/server -ssl irc.moparisthebest.com 6697” without the quotes.

Read full topic
item.source: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?

item.title: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

I went in to “Windows Firewall with Advanced Settings” and added a new rule to the Inbound Connection part. I made it so port 6667 wouldn’t be blocked off, but I’m still getting the same error. Now what? I really miss the IRC.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2009, 04:31:33 pm[/size][hr]Does the port 6667 apply to TCP or UDP?

Read full topic

item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

make sure remote port 6667 is open

item.title: I can't get on the IRC because of a Java problem. Help?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Now I get this error on Xchat.

[code]* Looking up irc.moparisthebest.com

  • Connecting to irc.moparisthebest.com (65.24.135.121) port 6667…
  • Connection failed. Error: An attempt was made to access a socket in a way forbidden by its access permissions[/code]
    Does it matter which port I connect to?
